summary: Feature request to support dynamic (catch-all) handlers for workflows, activities, signals, queries, and updates. Allows registering a single handler that receives the operation name and arguments for any unhandled operations of that type.
userImpact: Users can implement dynamic routing of workflows, activities, signals, queries, and updates without pre-registering each specific handler, enabling more flexible and generic implementations.
proposedFix: Register catch-all handlers that receive the operation name as first argument and args as array; signal/query/update handlers should also drain buffered unhandled operations when registered.
resolutionDetails: Implemented across multiple issues: workflows and signals in #1038, queries in #1639; activities and updates tracked separately in the checklist.
keyQuote: Should be able to register only one workflow as "dynamic" and it is given the name as a string as the first arg, then args as an array as the second arg.
